contexts.context: ...look at it is that if we're rescued, we can <mark>divide</mark> the profits between two rather than between twelve."
.... "And S'Riizh listens. When you said that a fortune <mark>divided</mark> by two was more profitable than a fortune divided by twelve...
...a fortune divided by two was more profitable than a fortune <mark>divided</mark> by twelve, S'Riizh listened to that too." S'Riizh shuffled back...
...the tree. "And it occurred to S'Riizh that a fortune <mark>divided</mark> by one was even better." S'Riizh pulled the spear out...
Later, however, disputes over religion <mark>divided</mark> the Council, with House Dwemer and House Dagoth on one...
